alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 29 at 11:09PM EDT until October 01 at 9:12PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, Middlesex, New Haven and New London. * WHEN...Until 100 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1109 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy rain moving through. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Guilford, Colchester, Clinton, East Hampton, Chester, Branford, East Haddam, Haddam, Lebanon, Westbrook, Killingworth, Lyme, North Madison, Lake Pocotopaug--East Hampton, Madison, Essex, Deep River and Moodus. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
